The seven '''suburbicarian dioceses''' are [[Roman Catholic]] [[diocese]]s located in the vicinity of [[Rome]], whose ([[titular bishop|titular]]) bishops form the highest-ranking order of [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|Cardinal]]s, the [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|Cardinal Bishop]]s.
The suburbicarian dioceses have varied slightly over time and nowadays consist of:
*the [[Bishop of Ostia|Diocese of Ostia]] (since 1150 the see of the [[Dean of the College of Cardinals]]) *the [[Roman Catholic Suburbicarian Diocese of Velletri-Segni|Diocese of Velletri-Segni]] *the [[Roman Catholic Suburbicarian Diocese of Porto-Santa Rufina|Diocese of Porto-Santa Rufina]] *the [[Roman Catholic Suburbicarian Diocese of Frascati|Diocese of Frascati (Tusculum)]] *the [[Roman Catholic Suburbicarian Diocese of Palestrina|Diocese of Palestrina]] *the [[Roman Catholic Suburbicarian Diocese of Albano|Diocese of Albano]] *the [[Roman Catholic Suburbicarian Diocese of Sabina-Poggio Mirteto|Diocese of Sabina-Poggio Mirteto]]
The see of Ostia is conferred on the [[Dean of the College of Cardinals]] in addition to the see he already had. (Until 1914, the Dean received the see of Ostia and Velletri in place of the see he had earlier. The sees of Ostia and Velletri were separated in 1914.) The Dean used to be the longest-serving cardinal bishop, but is now chosen by the six cardinal bishops with the approval of the [[pope]].
The increasing involvement of the Cardinal bishops in the administration of the papal curia resulted in a detachment from their dioceses. Therefore some of them, in particular the Bishops of Sabina and Velletri, have for centuries had auxiliary bishops and in 1910 [[Pope Pius X]] in his constitution ''Apostolicae Romanorum'' made this practice obligatory for all suburbicarian dioceses.<ref>''Catholic Encyclopedia'', "[http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/14324a.htm Suburbicarian Dioceses]", 1913.</ref> In 1962, [[Pope John XXIII]] in his decree ''Suburbicarii Sedis'' turned the Cardinal bishops into mere titular bishops and appointed diocesan bishops for Velletri-Segni, Porto-Santa-Rufina, Frascati, Palestrina, Albano and Sabina. The [[Diocese of Rome#Diocese of Ostia|diocese of Ostia]] — the titular diocese of the [[Dean of the College of Cardinals]] — was merged with the diocese of Rome and was henceforth administered by the [[Cardinal Vicar|Roman vicar general]]. Though the diocesan bishops exercise all episcopal administrative functions, the Cardinal bishops still formally take possession of their titular dioceses.
